import React from "react"; import { Helmet, HelmetProvider } from "react-helmet-async"; import { Container } from "react-bootstrap"; import "../style.css"; import "./project.css"; // 이미지 경로 설정 import projectBannerImg from "./img/snap/project3.jpg"; import personaImg from "./img/snap/persona.jpg"; import personaMobileImg from "./img/snap/snapMobile/persona_mobile.jpg"; import horizontalImg from "./img/snap/Horizontal.jpg"; import horizontalMobileImg from "./img/snap/snapMobile/Horizontal_mobile.jpg"; import horizontal2Img from "./img/snap/Horizontal2.jpg"; import horizontal2MobileImg from "./img/snap/snapMobile/Horizontal2_mobile.jpg"; import verticalImg from "./img/snap/vertical.jpg"; import verticalMobileImg from "./img/snap/snapMobile/vertical_mobile.jpg"; import vertical2Img from "./img/snap/vertical2.jpg"; import vertical2MobileImg from "./img/snap/snapMobile/vertical2_mobile.jpg"; import tableImg from "./img/snap/table.jpg"; const SnapProject = () => { return ( Snap Project | Portfolio {/* 상단 이미지 섹션 */}

Snap Project

Redesigning the SFU Snap app's dining feature for improved usability. Experience the updated design focused on ease of access, reviews, and detailed statistics.

{/* 컨텍스트 식별 섹션 */}

Context Identification

When it comes to meal time, students and staff must eat. Even if they are not hungry, they need a variety of intakes, such as caffeine drinks and snacks, to accompany them when they are sleepy. All campuses of Simon Fraser University provide a variety of eateries near them. To find the right eatery to go to, they use the dining feature of the SFU Snap app to explore their options. The dining feature only shows the name and operating hours of the nearby eateries, so users have to use other sources of information to find out the types of food sold, distance and reviews, etc. They typically want to find a good eatery as soon as possible.

User Persona
{/* 요구사항 섹션 */}

Functional and Non-Functional Requirements

Requirement #1:
Users should be able to make a review about an eatery based on its atmosphere, taste, price and accessibility using a 5-star rating system.
Non-Functional Requirement:
The system should update the lists of reviews in less than 1 second after it has been written.

{/* 디자인 프로세스 섹션 */}

Design Process

We have reviewed each other’s LFP sketches from part 1 of the project. After reviewing, we have decided the general look of the interface from one of the sketches. Then, we have researched other review services such as Google reviews, Yelp, and TripAdvisor and integrated their elements into our LFP sketches. The sketch was developed and used as a blueprint of our final MFP design.

{/* 수평 MFP 섹션 */}

Horizontal MFP

Upon opening the app, users will first see the dashboard screen. Users can tap the dining button on the grid, or tap the “More” button on the bottom tab and press the dining button to access the dining feature.

{/* 수직 MFP 섹션 */}

Vertical MFP

For our vertical MFP, we have implemented the “reviewing feature” in depth. The situation is that a user wants to leave a review for an eatery they found using the SFU snap app. Users can access the dining feature by tapping the “Dining” button.

{/* 인지적 워크스루 섹션 */}

Cognitive Walkthrough

Context and scenario given to the evaluator:
You are a new student at Simon Fraser University. You are having a hard time finding a place to eat around Burnaby campus.

{/* 총평 섹션 */}

Summary of walkthrough:

The walkthrough was done without a big struggle. The evaluator has commented that our design was very intuitive and eye-catching.

{/* 최종 반영 섹션 */}

Reflection

The redesign of the SFU snap app was an interesting task because not only we were asked to redesign an existing app, but also we had to design a new system - the review system - to an existing feature.


); }; export default SnapProject;
